title: Vertical Integration Concept Mapping Design for Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Current elementary school teachers struggle to connect theory and practice in mathematics education, necessitating systematic structuring of curriculum content via concept mapping.

learning_goals: Learners can visualize elementary mathematics curriculum content (operations, geometry, measurement, etc.) via concept mapping to explain interconnections across domains.
Learners can analyze actual classroom cases and represent the linkage between theoretical concepts and educational applications through concept maps.
Learners can submit a final output where the completeness of the concept map is improved by at least 80% through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
